alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL SANDOVAL AND BERNALILLO COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM MDT... At 614 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northwestern Albuquerque, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Corrales, Bernalillo, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Enchanted Hills, Mariposa, Cabezon, Coronado State Monument and Vista Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 141 and 171, and between Mile Markers 173 and 174. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 218 and 244. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; West Central Highlands
